You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Boost Storefront Traffic with SEO

To attract more traffic to your storefront, serve your product data and other storefront information directly to search engine bots. Search engines use the data they collect about your website to build an index of your pages. The more consistent and complete the information search engines have about your storefront, the more likely it is that searches can return results from your storefront. B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides several options for boosting the search engine optimization (SEO) ranking of your storefront.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
Specify SEO Metadata for Storefront Pages
Control the title and description that search engines show for your storefront’s Home page and Product List page in search results. Specify the keywords that you expect people to use to find your site so that your storefront can surface in results based on that keyword.
Specify SEO Metadata for Products and Categories
When setting up your products and categories, complete the appropriate SEO fields for your product and category records. B2B Commerce for Visualforce uses the content from these fields to populate metadata in your bot-enabled Product Detail page and construct friendly URLs.
Canonical URLs for Storefront Pages
Storefront users can arrive at a particular page by following links that use several parameters, such as locale, query data, and session data. Multiple combinations of parameters can resolve to the same page. For human users, this practice doesn’t affect their storefront experience. However, search engine bots evaluate each combination of parameters as a different URL, and index each URL separately. As a result, search engines can create duplicate index entries of a particular page, which dilutes your storefront’s SEO ranking. To combat index duplication, B2B Commerce for Visualforce can insert a canonical URL in the <head> of certain pages. A canonical URL tells search engine bots the authoritative path of a page, which prevents bots from redundant indexing and boosts your SEO ranking.
Alternate Language Links for Storefront Pages
If your storefront supports multiple regions and languages, you can make sure that external search engines index your localized pages. Search engines can then show results from your localized storefront in searches from a supported locale. For each language that your storefront supports, B2B Commerce for Visualforce can insert an alternate language link in the <head> of certain pages. The alternate language metadata supplements the page's canonical URL, which references the storefront guest user's locale.
Insert Canonical URLs and Alternate Language URLs
Add canonical URLs and alternate language URLs to your page metadata.
Parameters in Storefront Page URLs
B2B Commerce for Visualforce passes certain information about the current user’s storefront session from page to page using URL parameters. These parameters generally apply only to the activity of a logged-in user, and multiple combinations of parameters can resolve to the same destination page.
Serve Friendly URLs for Storefront Pages
Boost your storefront’s SEO ranking by serving URLs that are human-readable, include keywords, and reflect taxonomies. This information provides search engines with valuable insight into the content and structure of your storefront. You can specify friendly URL paths for products and categories. B2B Commerce for Visualforce uses these paths in URLs for the Product List page and the Product Detail page.
Refresh Storefront Site Index Records
To help storefront pages quickly utilize friendly URLs and breadcrumb paths for categories, B2B Commerce for Visualforce maintains site index records. Each site index record describes a single category's friendly URL and its associated breadcrumb path for a specific storefront and locale. When you change a category's friendly URL value, refresh your site index records so that your storefront always uses the most recent category URLs.
Serve Bot-Enabled Versions of Storefront Pages
By default, storefront pages load data asynchronously. This implementation supports customized front-end experiences and back-end data delivery, but because the data loads asynchronously, bots can crawl the pages before all the data loads. As a result, search engines can miss some of your product and category content. To ensure that bots see all your products and categories, B2B Commerce for Visualforce can detect whether a visitor is a bot or regular site user. If the visitor is a bot, B2B Commerce for Visualforce can serve static, synchronously loaded, data-complete versions of certain pages.
Generate Dynamic Sitemaps for Storefront Categories
A sitemap provides a list of your site’s URLs, and metadata about each URL, that you want search engine bots to crawl. Search engines use a sitemap to learn more about the structure of your site. If a site has thousands of pages, a sitemap is especially useful to make sure that search engine bots crawl all of your content. When a site has multiple sitemaps, a sitemap index links all sitemaps from one location.
Control Traffic from Search Engines with robots.txt
To help manage search engine bot activity on your storefront pages, a robots.txt file links to your sitemap index and specifies URLs to block from being crawled. B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides a default robots.txt file that you can assign to your Experience Cloud site. You can also create a custom robots.txt file, depending on your storefront setup and the pages you want to block from being crawled.
